metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8176 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The dtls1_clear_queues function in ssl/d1_lib.c in OpenSSL before 0.9.8za, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0m, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1h frees data structures without considering that application data can arrive between a ChangeCipherSpec message and a Finished message, which allows remote DTLS peers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via unexpected application data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8176` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2c-1ubuntu1
openssl - 1.0.2c-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Praveen Kariyanahalli, Ivan Fratric and Felix Groebert

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.2c-1ubuntu1').
